TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1273
TEI.2.document_title: Armistead Moore to Stephen F. Austin, et al., 03-15-1826

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1273

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Texan interest in Kentucky.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Round lick*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="03-15-1826">March 15 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Messrs. *person_mentioned*Austin*/person_mentioned* *person_mentioned*Williams*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Ingram*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Gentlemen owing to high waters I have been prevented from writing to you as Early as I Contemplated, *location_mentioned*Cumberland river*/location_mentioned* has not been so high for*date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1791"> 35 years past*/date_mentioned*, we have not had a mail on that account since I got *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned*, when I arrived here I was sorrey to find my son *person_mentioned*William*/person_mentioned* had made other arrangements than whot I expected, his Boats ware ready to sail to *location_mentioned*N. Orleans*/location_mentioned* Loaded with Frieght which compelld him to make his returns to the *person_mentioned*people*/person_mentioned* here this *date_mentioned n="Spring - 1826">Spring*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*if I can sell my possesions in this *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned* this *date_mentioned n="Summer - 1826">summer */date_mentioned*I will be with you *date_mentioned n="Spring - 1827">Next Spring*/date_mentioned* if not as soon as I possibley can without makeing two grate sacrifices I am sorrey to Disapoint you in the Articles I promised to send you as also my *person_mentioned*son*/person_mentioned* will be Disapointed in geting his Mill Irone if I get off *date_mentioned n="Spring - 1876">Next Spring*/date_mentioned* I will take a pleasure in accomodating you with the Articles you sent for. I hope you will write to me when ever your convenience will admit I should be Truely glad to hear from you often, what New laws are Enacted what the *person_mentioned*Commissioner*/person_mentioned* has done how the *location_mentioned*Countrey*/location_mentioned* progresses in settling etc*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Armistead Moore*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*please to Direct your letters to me at *location_mentioned*Roundlick Smith County, Tennissee*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
